alert.note: Alert for Catalina and Santa Barbara Islands; Los Angeles County Beaches; Malibu Coast (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued January 11 at 2:06PM PST until January 12 at 12:00PM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM PST THIS EVENING... ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT IN EFFECT FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the High Surf Advisory, large breaking waves of 4 to 7 feet with dangerous rip currents. For the Beach Hazards Statement, nuisance coastal flooding expected during Friday morning high tide. * WHERE...Catalina and Santa Barbara Islands, Malibu Coast and Los Angeles County Beaches. * WHEN...For the High Surf Advisory, until 9 PM PST this evening. For the Beach Hazards Statement, Friday morning. * IMPACTS...There is an increased risk for ocean drowning. Rip currents can pull swimmers and surfers out to sea. Large breaking waves can cause injury, wash people off beaches and rocks, and capsize small boats near shore. Nuisance coastal flooding expected during Friday morning high tide. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...High tides of 7.0 to 7.2 feet expected around 900 AM.
info.instruction: Remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions, or stay near occupied lifeguard towers. Rock jetties can be deadly in such conditions, stay off the rocks.

area.areaDesc: Catalina and Santa Barbara Islands; Los Angeles County Beaches; Malibu Coast
